Description: Rim fragment from large, shallow, pottery lekanis (or lid?); flat projecting rim with angular plastic band lower down on body; band of rectangles on outside of rim; below, broken maeander; dots on the plastic band, and banding on the lower wall. Inside reserved. Dense clay with some lime and little or no mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 31)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.381)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4735 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
